intro: Aegle barteri, commonly known as the African star apple, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, glossy leaves. The tree produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that give way to round, green fruits with a tough outer skin. The fruit contains a white, fleshy pulp surrounding a central core with edible seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of edible fruit in its native regions.
